questions.question: What is the double negation law?
questions.explanation: Law: negate twice returns to original. Equivalence: both formulas same. Proof: truth table shows. Application: remove double negatives. Importance: simplification. Restriction: intuitionistic logic differs.

questions.question: What is the absorption law?
questions.explanation: Law: p absorbs (pq). Equivalence: both formulas same. Proof: truth table shows. Application: eliminate redundant terms. Importance: simplification. Dual: p(pq)  p.

questions.question: What is the complement law?
questions.explanation: Law: p or not p always true (excluded middle). p and not p always false (non-contradiction). Proof: truth table shows. Application: reasoning base. Importance: fundamental laws.

questions.question: What is involution?
questions.explanation: Law: same as double negation law. Name: involution emphasizes self-inverse. Equivalence: negation involution. Proof: truth table shows. Application: simplification. Importance: basic property.

questions.question: What is the conditional equivalence?
questions.explanation: Law: implication equals negated antecedent OR consequent. Equivalence: both formulas same. Proof: truth table shows. Application: eliminate conditionals. Importance: transformation rule.

questions.question: What is the biconditional equivalence?
questions.explanation: Law: biconditional both directions. Equivalence: both formulas same. Proof: truth table shows. Application: decompose biconditionals. Importance: transformation rule.

questions.question: What is the law of excluded middle?
questions.explanation: Law: p or not p always true. Foundation: classical logic. Equivalence: true always. Proof: truth table shows. Application: proof by cases. Controversy: intuitionistic logic disagrees.

questions.question: What is the law of non-contradiction?
questions.explanation: Law: p and not p always false. Foundation: logical consistency. Equivalence: false always. Proof: truth table shows. Application: contradiction detection. Importance: essential principle.

questions.question: What is substitution principle?
questions.answer: Replace equivalent with equivalent preserves equivalence
questions.explanation: Principle: if pq, substitute p with q anywhere. Context: in any formula. Result: truth value unchanged. Proof: from equivalence definition. Application: formula transformation. Importance: enables simplification.

questions.question: What is logical consequence?
questions.explanation: Consequence: p  q means q true when p true. Notation:  symbol. Equivalence: pq iff pq and qp. Application: reasoning chains. Importance: fundamental concept.
